Reviews.Title: “Excellent value/location choice”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Very happy with motel, it was a very reasonable price and you can walk everywhere from here, across the park to the zoo, over to Seapoint village and the harbour or very quickly to the Gaslamp quarter. The room was very clean and totally bed bug free :) Very comfortable beds and pillows. The maid service was very good and the motel provides mini toiletries in the room - shampoo, soap, lotion. There was also a fridge/microwave/hairdryer/safe and ironing facilities in the room and an ice machine down the hall. Could not here a peep from neighbouring rooms. There was a fair amount of traffic noise until about 1am but did not here any voices from the street. We were on the 1st floor, overlooking the road and we did not have a balcony. Breakfast is included and ran from 6.30-9.30am. A selection of packaged muffins, packaged danish pastries, cereal, toast, juice cartons, tea/coffee, bagels, toast and childrens yogurt.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rich8506
Reviews.Content: This was a great motel in downtown San Diego... my room was large, it had a balcony with a nice view, it was very quiet, it felt safe, and it was extremely clean, all staff were very pleasant. I couldn't have asked for better. I'd definitely recommend. It's always good to leave constructive criticism, so I think the breakfast could have been slightly better. The bread/bagels had been frozen and had been left to thaw before being served, so when you came to toast it, it was slightly cold in the middle. Maybe they could splash out on some normal temperature bread bought every few days. But that's my only criticism. Thanks Days Inn San Diego for a nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: artathomesd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Days Inn several times over the last 4 years and always enjoy a very clean and comfortable room with a balcony and view fora very reasonable price. Days Inn is very convenient to the Gaslamp area, Symphony Hall and numerous very good restaurnats within walking distance. Another reason to stay here is the wonderful sevice one gets from Ramiro at the front desk. He is so efficient and so helpful with whatever need a guest might have. I have never had to wait long checking in even when there have been several people ahead of me. He is so friendly and really makes an effort to make all the guests feel welcomed. He makes the guests feel like they are in a home away from home He is a real asset to this Days Inn property!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Motel”
Reviews.Author: Clembo1957
Reviews.Content: A good value motel in downtown San Diego, the room was clean though looked like it had seen better days, a good modern TV two double beds and a reasonable bathroom. For the cost i knew what to expect but the Days Inn wasn't bad. I saw no evidence of bedbugs during my stay! Reception staff were friendly and helpful though when we asked one receptionist to book us a taxi for early the next morning he didn't do so. The hotel was fairly quiet during my stay and is within walking distance of the Gaslamp Quarter and downtown. A free continental breakfast is served though we didn't check that out. If you want a cheap place to stay for one /two nights the Days Inn is worth a shot but don't expect a 4 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Giacomo S
Reviews.Content: This is a great Motel located in the downtown of San Diego, only 5 to 10 minutes walk to every interest point. Super clean, confortable, fully equipped. Staff is absolutely professional and very kind. I definitely suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: shortdlee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Days Inn and this one to say the least was not what I had come to expect. We are staying for a week and I am serious about looking for a different place to stay. We could not connect to the FREE Wi-Fi, bulbs were burned out in the lights, we had to pay a $10.00 a day parking fee in the Hotel Parking area. It is not very close to anything and you need a car to get to anywhere for dining or shopping. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, rooms are better than outside appearance”
Reviews.Author: Patti_b50
Reviews.Content: The outside appearance looks very unappealling. The rooms were much nice than I expected. Rooms were clean, large and had many amenities..small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Downtown location was okay but was rather noisy. Parking is an additional$10

Reviews.Title: “Nice touches in room”
Reviews.Author: Mary W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for just one night and we knew this hotel was going to be old. We were not excepting much. What I was amazed to see was the personal FREE things in our room. There were two bottles of water in the refrigerator, a bag of microwavable popcorn and two health bars for a snack. These are small things but they meant a lot. The bed was comfortable and the view was surprisingly beautiful looking downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cosy room but require a car”
Reviews.Author: Park7
Reviews.Content: Room is the highlight as it is Cosy. It has the feeling of personal touch. Staff are friendly and helpful. Car park available on the property at $10 per day. Complimentary breakfast is very basic. If you have a car then location is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this location.”
Reviews.Author: Raubsm
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Days Inn on Ash Street in San Diego, room 414 to be exact. As soon as I got into the room I sat down on a chair next to the round table and it nearly crumbled into pieces. The outlets are completely worn out and will not hold the prongs properly. The power went out in the room numerous times. But the big one was on the last night of my stay...at 2:15 am water began dripping from the ceiling all over the room. My luggage was soaked and so was the bed. We obviously could not sleep, so we checked out early. When we told the "professional" at the counter what was going on, all he could say is...."sorry, should I charge the rate to the card on hand"? He didn't try in any way to make it right. Trust me, stay somewhere else. This place sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in downtown San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan L
Reviews.Content: I was truly very surprised by how pleasant my stay at this Days Inn was! The Front Desk clerks were all very helpful, especially Justin (hope I remembered that correctly!). The Breakfast was MUCH more substantial than what I was expecting, and in general was a great bonus. The location is very close to the Gaslamp District, Petco Park, the Harbor, the Zoo, and just about every other main San Diego attraction. I definitely plan to stay at this Hotel the next time we visit San Diego and highly recommend it! Thanks again Justin for all your help!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: SWIBC
Reviews.Content: Located on SE portion of Downtown, not a bad hotel but for $99 a night in San Diego Downtown it is fine. Staff was very nice and breakfast was minimal, mainly muffins, cereal, and juice. Room was adequate, Space was fine for a couple or single. Balcony overlooking Downtown was nice addition. TV was horrid half the channels did not come in well and how does a hotel not have ESPN or the like.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: msal3104
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were not expecting much since we made last minute reservations. Before booking up this hotel I had mixed feelings whether to proceed or not, reading a few reviews about the property, the breakfast etc. I continued and booked up with them and I never regretted! It was a good experience staying with them. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Days Inn. This was my first stay at a Days Inn. I was really surprised by how much they offer for free (internet, breakfast, etc.), things I typically pay extra for at other hotels. The front desk staff was all very helpful and friendly. The room (king) was spacious, and smelled clean, the comforter and blanket were very soft. Lots of big confortable pillows, and had a nice view of downtown, with a balcony. We didn't use the mini-fridge or microwave, but they are nice to have in a room. We spent a wonderful evenings in the Gaslamp Quarter, which were very close. We’ll return to San Diego and we’ll definitely stay here again. The only downside was the parking, in the website said “free parking” and when we got to the motel we were charged $10dlls for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Real Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Bharathy
Reviews.Content: Before booking up this hotel I had mixed feelings whether to proceed or not ,reading a few reviews here about the property, breakfast etc. I continued and booked up with them and I never regretted! It was a good experience staying with them. Real Value for Money!, the double room, we booked as we had children with us, was spacious, bed -comfortable with lovely set of pillows! Rooms were cleaned up in a prompt way. The breakfast was really filling with 3 kinds of donuts, chocolate chip muffins, 2 kinds of sticky buns, fruits, cereals, milk, coffee, tea and juices! It is conveniently located which has access to buses and trolleys and not too far from the airport as well! Last but not the least we appreciated immensely the service rendered by Jeff, who was taking care of the reception, who was kind and much helpful to us!

Reviews.Title: “I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Days Inn. I'll definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: carr403
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Days Inn. I first came to San Diego for a convention and have since returned a few times. This was my first stay at a Days Inn anywhere. I was really surprised by how much they offer for free (internet, breakfast, etc), things I typically pay extra for at other hotels. On the day I arrived, I saw that they were moving in several new mattresses, and I was lucky enough to get a brand new mattress for my stay. If only my mattress at home was as comfortable! The front desk staff were all very helpful and friendly, and the housekeeping department did a great job cleaning my room each day. I spent time during the day at Balboa Park, and a couple of wonderful evenings in the Gaslamp Quarter, both of which were very close by. I only wish I had stayed here the last time I came to town for a cruise, since it is also very close to the cruise terminal. I'll be returning for another convention at the Convention Center soon, and I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a good location for a very good value including free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: cchagas
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with family. Location is great, very close to downtown, harbor and Gas Lamp district. Rooms are OK and standard. Free breakfast was OK and represent an important point travelling with a family of 4, although having it in the very tight lobby of the hotel is extremelly uncomfortable. The is almost no place to seat. If more than two families are present, it is impossible to accomodate everyone. Staff is friendly. Room service however is not 24h. We needed an extra towel at 07:00 AM (there wasn´t sufficient towes for the four of us), phoned the reception and were informed that there would be cleaning staff only after 0800 hs. Therefore, I had to go to the reception myself, which was not a big deal anyway. In sum, very good value combining location, accomodations and price.

Reviews.Title: “A truly amazing deal”
Reviews.Author: USALove2Travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in January. Downtown San Digoe hotels can be expensive, but we got an amazing rate directly on Days Inn's website (with a more relaxed cancellation policy than Expedia). The hotel is a 10 min drive from the airport, and a few blocks from I5, a 20-min walk from the Gas Lamp district (safe walk, good exercise and saves on the parking fees at night). Checkin was smooth, with very friendly and courteous front desk staff. The room (king) was spacious, clean, and had a nice view of downtown, with a balcony. A complimentary in-room safe was a pleasant suprise. We didn't use the mini-fridge or microwave, but those could be quite handy for many other guests. Breakfast is served in the lobby area, with a good variety of items (pastries, oatmeal, juices, coffee/tea, fruit), although there isn't much place to sit so most guests take their breakfast back to their rooms. The free parking worked well for us and our midsize rental, but SUVs/minivans/trucks might have a challenge parking in the rear parking lot (no issue with the front parking lot). There is street parking next to the hotel (free at night, metered during the day). Overall, an amazing deal to top off a wonderful trip in SD. Hope to stayer here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel, but nice and clean.”
Reviews.Author: sweet_sac
Reviews.Content: i would recommend Days Inn for anybody travelling to San Diego on a bit of a budget but not wishing to stay in a grubby downtown hostel! On arrival we did find the car park a little cramped, but it wasn't a great problem to squeeze the car in. Check-in was easy and as we were staying a few days we were offered a top floor room with a view of downtown towards Petco Park. Easy walking distance to Gaslamp and the ballpark, rooms cleaned every day and fresh towels etc. Only downside was when we went to check out at 5-30am there was nobody on the desk, so we have to slide a note under the door and post the keys through the letterbox!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nice, people that stay there aren't!”
Reviews.Author: octravlr78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a corner in a decent location downtown, which was in walking distance to a lot of restaurants and shops. The parking lot (which you don't get charged for) is tiny and the spaces are practically on top of each other- but at least you don't have to pay for it. Our room was on the 3rd floor and was really clean and spacious. The only complaint about the room - the heater did not work and the towels sucked. Other than that there were no complaints about the room. The staff was decent yet seemed a litle lax in some areas - we were awoken at 2:30am by drunks coming in and the noise and chaos lasted toooooo long before the hotel staff decided to do anything about it. I had to call downstairs and even attempted to call the police. It was annoying! When I told the hotel staff in the morning, they only said they can't do a lot about it due to people partying....they offered us a "discount" the next time we stay - but provided no proof of it and only gave us their "card." So I doubt that will happen. The continental breakfast was like any other at a hotel - donuts, cereal and fruit. However, there was no where to sit...they have it sitting out in their lobby which is tiny. I wouldn't mind staying there again because of location and decency of the room, but the staff need to get a hold of their patrons and make it decent for the rest of the people that stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Gaslamp Quarters”
Reviews.Author: wildbirdseed
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right downtown near the action of the Gaslamp Quarters in San Diego. It's a great place to stay if you want to hit up the nightlife, walk and shop. Free parking, exterior room entrances. At first sight: Our room was a decent size and smelled clean. The comforter and blanket were store bought and therefore softer than expected. Pillows were too thick for sleeping well. Big closet space, some rooms must be for long-term stay. Upon closer inspection: The "air filter" was a piece of quilt batting cut to fit...I'm pretty sure that's not to code guys. Free breakfast was donuts and toast with coffee. Blah! We used our reward points, so our stay was free. It was a decent hotel, expected more for something downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: BENelson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I was not expecting much since we made last minute reservations. However, upon seeing the rooms when we arrived, we were both taken back by the over all refinement and beauty of the rooms. They where quite comfortable and the prices where just right. Also, kudos to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: twink62
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at this hotel. It was the first stop on a ten day trip from San Diego to SF. The staff was great. Very nice and helpful. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. We would probably stay here again as long as we had a car.

Reviews.Title: “What are they thinking?”
Reviews.Author: turtle_travels_08
Reviews.Content: The location was okay for my trip. That was a good thing. The downside was the hotel was old. The walls were thin. Saw lack of security here. People hanging around the cars all night long. Asked for an escort to my car. Desk said sorry. I am coming back to San Diego in 5 months. My client suggested I meet them here again. This trip the room rate I paid was $149. In 5 months I checked multiple travel sites and all of them show the room rate increases to 10 THOUSAND DOLLARS for ONE NIGHT. I want to rent a room and not refurbish the room, which by the way could use some sprucing up. By the way, this is downtown and not even near the beach. For $10,000 a night i wonder what they were smoking? Overall the place was good to try once. I told client I'll meet them in LaJolla and somewhere near the beach for that money. Would I recommend this place to someone. Let me say I would stay in a Motel 6 before I stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn San Diego Ash Street”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodCAguy
Reviews.Content: Price was okay , rooms are LArge and clean, carpet OK, heater OK, TV Refrig CoffeeMaker 8 out 10 !!!TOWELS!!!! OLD AND NOT VERY SOFT RATING 1 OUT 10. You can hear whats going on next room because wall was soooo thin Front desk guy was very nice and cute :-) AND THEY HAVE FREE BREAKFAST ))) UMMM 5 OUT 10 NOTHING SPECIAL...

Reviews.Title: “bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: allisonandjeff
Reviews.Content: For the price, it has decent ammenities - free breakfast and internet. Rooms aren't bad. Good location to downtown, but not very close to the convention center - about 1/2 mile. The location and price attracts groups of young partiers, and unfortunately the floors and walls are very thin. If you need to sleep, ask to be put on the top floor. Both weekend nights I was awakened numerous times heavy-footed guests above and then by a group of partiers next door. I am exhausted and it was not a restful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: GarminGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and that was enough. I was out all day sightseeing so I didn't need a better class hotel. Pros: could walk a few blocks to restaurants, shopping, trolley tour, etc.,free continental breakfast, private balcony,deli across the street at a Condo complex.(sells everything!) Cons: sink was not in the bathroom (it was next to the door as you walk inside room)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, If You Can Get A Good Price”
Reviews.Author: 2RInsider
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at a much cheaper hotel in San Diego, but when I saw the Days Inn at $59, I jumped. The place was fabulous, really only a few small steps (bad breakfast, lukewarm customer service) away from a 4 star hotel. (Yeah, I know it's a Days Inn!) The furnishings were beautiful, the lighting was great, the view was fabulous, the bed and pillows comfy, and there's plenty of room. So I swore my loyalty to this new hotel, then went back to book it for my next trip two weeks later, and discovered it was now $119, double the old price. Is it worth that price? Probably, if that's your budget. But I would guess that you wouldn't choose Days Inn first at that price. Bear in mind that the San Diego hotel market is terribly tight, and even bad rooms command a high price here... But if you see it again at $59, book it, you'll be thrilled.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: djbowl
Reviews.Content: Booked via Expidia at about 2 pm. Turned up at 5 pm all went smoothly. Got a balcony that was the only motel room I had in the USA with one. Clean but basic Toilet flush very very loudly but that is my only complaint. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Price was way too high for what you get”
Reviews.Author: pacweaver
Reviews.Content: The room was cheap. There was no parking available, had to park on the street and walk. The bed was uncomfortable, and extremely small. You could hear everyone else who stayed there. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a convention”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I found out that I was staying at a Days Inn for a large convention that I was attending in Downtown San Diego, I was disappointed. When I got to the hotel, though, I was pleasantly surprised. The desk staff was so great and they don't nickle and dime you like the big hotels. I had free internet access and free parking...what a savings!! I really thought the location was great and I was able to walk to anywhere I wanted to go. Some of my associates stayed closer to the Gaslamp and ended up spending almost three times as much as me with parking and tipping and everything else. I'll take the Days Inn next year when I come back. They even said when I come back I can call directly and they will give me a special rate for my return visit. I was VERY happy.

Reviews.Title: “Was a bit of a ripoff”
Reviews.Author: norm1932
Reviews.Content: Booked not knowing that this rate on internet was too high plus they charged for a safe I did not use plus it is an old place being renovated. Noise level from courtyard high on the weekend there. Paid more for this room than any of the other two locations in San Diego we stayed in.Was the poorest for location and quality. Also only place that charged to use email. Look around before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn-Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: ryanflaate
Reviews.Content: Days Inn San Diego Hotel Circle was an excellent hotel. The room was a great value for what we paid. The staff was extremely; as they always willing to go the extra distance for what we needed including unpgrading us to a business class room when they made a mistake and booked two different groups for our original room. The location was great with restaurants such as Hunter Steakhouse and Denny's nearby plus a little quaint cafe on the hotel premises. The location was central with Qualcomm Stadium (home of the Chargers), Mission Bay + Sea World no more than five miles away & shopping centers such as Fashion Valley directly down the street. I will definitetly stay at the hotel again when I return to San Diego

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn San Diego Downtown/Convention Center
HotelInfo.Address: 833 Ash Street, San Diego, CA 92101
